description:
Engineers are rare, jobs are plenty, so far so good. But what if I don’t
just want any job that pays the bills, but the job that will push my
career and that I actually enjoy doing every day? If your answer to why
you’d like to join company XY is: “Work from home and make good money”,
you should not be surprised to not be taken into the next round. But
what would be a good answer to that question? What should I say when
asked where I see myself in 5 years? There are a lot of subtle aspects
to succeeding and failing in the application process, from your initial
cover letter to the on site visit meeting the team. As a tech recruiter,
I’d like to share with you the best and (sometimes quite entertaining)
worst practices in the application process in order to help you get the
job you want!
title: How do I get the job I want?
